title: rustdoc: `assertion failed: !ty.needs_infer()` on unconstrained lifetime

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code `tests/ui/impl-unused-rps-in-assoc-type.rs` Rustdoc would previously eat that without error. ```Rust // Test that lifetime parameters must be constrained if they appear in // an associated type def'n. Issue #22077. trait Fun { type Output; fn call<'x>(&'x self) -> Self::Output; } struct Holder { x: String } impl<'a> Fun for Holder { //~ ERROR E0207 type Output = &'a str; fn call<'b>(&'b self) -> &'b str { &self.x[..] } } fn main() { } ``` reduced to ````rust trait Fun { type Output; fn call(&self) -> Self::Output; } impl<'a> Fun for () { type Output = &'a str; fn call(&self) -> &str {} } ```` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: searched toolchains 1716932743a7b3705cbf0c34db0c4e070ed1930d through ab654863c3d50482f260cf862647f1fe0ff5e010 ******************************************************************************** Regression in e84e5ff04a647ce28540300244a26ba120642eea ******************************************************************************** cc @aliemjay ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace
